s0591: When Qin lost its governance, Chen She first raised difficulties; heroes arose like a swarm of bees and competed together—their numbers cannot be counted.
s0592: Yet Yu without even a foot or inch of territory, riding and rising from among the fields, in three years then led the five feudal lords to destroy Qin, divided and carved up all under Heaven, and enfeoffed kings and marquises; governance issued from Yu; he was titled "Hegemon-King"—though his position did not last, from ancient times until now there has never been such a case.
s0593: When Yu turned his back on Guanzhong and longed for Chu, banished the Righteous Emperor and made himself king, resentment grew and the kings and marquises rebelled against him—this was difficult indeed.
s0594: Boasting of his achievements and victories, flourishing his personal cleverness without following the ancients, thinking the hegemon-king's enterprise could be managed by conquering all under Heaven through force alone—in five years he finally lost his state; his body died at Dongcheng, yet still he did not awaken or blame himself—this was an error.
s0595: To then say "Heaven destroyed me, it was not any fault in my use of troops"—is this not absurd!
